CatDescriptText: Mr. Clifton Pitts, bartender, 70 Fullerton Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 12, 1957, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think the Little Rock, Ark. school integration incident will gain more financial support for the NAACP in its continuing fight for equal rights?"  Answer reads: "Yes, I think the Little Rock integration fight will gain more financial support for the NAACP."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Clifton Pitts wearing apron and standing with hand on hip, in bar with sign inscribed "No Side Like Ringside"
